definition: to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)

sentences.english: They traveled in quest of gold.
sentences.chinese: 他们为寻找黄金而长途跋涉。

sentences.english: An actor circling the stage suggests a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 而演员绕台奔走则代表长途跋涉。

sentences.english: After a long walk, he wore a black sweat.
sentences.chinese: 长途跋涉后，他出了一身臭汗。

sentences.english: Grumeti River is the only source of water on their long and tough journey.
sentences.chinese: 在这艰辛的长途跋涉中，格鲁美地河是唯一的水源。

sentences.english: With a lack of IMAX theaters, people are traveling long distances to see the movie.
sentences.chinese: 由于IMAX影院稀缺，人们不惜长途跋涉。

sentences.english: It has taken Jean Beliveau 11 years to make the trek.
sentences.chinese: 贝力弗花了11年来完成了他的长途跋涉。

sentences.english: This might involve going on a long journey or sending a communication by messenger.
sentences.chinese: 与人交流很可能需要长途跋涉，或派使者送信。

sentences.english: Her feet blistered during the long hike.
sentences.chinese: 长途跋涉中她的脚起泡了。

sentences.english: Two mules well-laden with packs were trudging along.
sentences.chinese: 两头骡子驮着包裹长途跋涉。

sentences.english: Two monks are on a day-long walk to a temple.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，两个僧人长途跋涉要到一个寺院去。

sentences.english: My throat was dry after the long trip.
sentences.chinese: 经过长途跋涉，我的喉咙发干。

sentences.english: Instead, he traipsed around the world, chasing shadows.
sentences.chinese: 相反，他却在世界上长途跋涉，追逐着影子。

sentences.english: May Neglect the Fear of Trapse By Reason of Desiring to See U.
sentences.chinese: 我可以不顾长途跋涉的恐惧，因为我要见你。

sentences.english: These camels travelled enormous distance over the desert regions.
sentences.chinese: 这些骆驼在沙漠里长途跋涉。

sentences.english: A young man roaming the desert came across a spring.
sentences.chinese: 一个在沙漠中长途跋涉的年轻人经过一泓清泉。

sentences.english: Diop has made the trek back almost annually.
sentences.chinese: 迪奥普几乎每年都长途跋涉回到老家。

definition: to travel over land and water (idiom)
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to climb mountains and wade rivers (idiom); fig. to make a long and difficult journey
